hypothesis_content.title: US Market Open Breakout Fade in a Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime (as defined by FjordHQ), a sharp 1-hour breakout (>1.5% move) at or immediately following the US equity market open (14:30 UTC) that fails to attract follow-through volume by the next hourly close has a high probability of a full retracement within the same trading day.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong trend momentum. US open often creates liquidity-driven false moves. Low volume on the next candle indicates a lack of real commitment, setting up for a fade back to the session's value area (VWAP).
entry_conditions: Between 14:30-15:30 UTC, BTC has a 1-hour range > 1.5% of opening price
The breakout candle closes in top/bottom 25% of its range (showing weakness)
The FOLLOWING 1-hour candle has volume < 80% of breakout candle volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces to the VWAP of the 14:00-15:30 UTC period.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high/low of the low-volume confirmation candle.
exit_conditions.time_exit: Exit at 21:00 UTC (NY close) if target not met.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: In a neutral regime, over 35% of such low-volume-follow-through signals after a US-open breakout continue in the breakout direction for more than a 2% move beyond the entry point.
